https://gs1.org/voc/Element.title: Element
https://gs1.org/voc/Element.description: A chemical element from the periodic table.

https://w3id.org/traceability/atomicNumb.title: Atomic Number
https://w3id.org/traceability/atomicNumb.description: The number of protons in the nucleus of an atom.

https://w3id.org/traceability/chemIdPlus.title: NIH ChemID Plus
https://w3id.org/traceability/chemIdPlus.description: A link for more information regarding this element.

https://w3id.org/traceability/webElement.title: Web Element
https://w3id.org/traceability/webElement.description: A link for more information regarding this element.

https://w3id.org/traceability/casRegistr.title: CAS Registry Number
https://w3id.org/traceability/casRegistr.description: A CAS Registry Number, also referred to as CASRN or CAS Number, is a unique numerical identifier assigned by the Chemical Abstracts Service to every chemical substance described in the open scientific literature, including organic and inorganic compounds, minerals, isotopes, alloys and nonstructurable materials.

schema.title: Element
schema.description: A chemical element from the periodic table.

atomicNumber.title: Atomic Number
atomicNumber.description: The number of protons in the nucleus of an atom.

chemIdPlus.title: NIH ChemID Plus
chemIdPlus.description: A link for more information regarding this element.

webElement.title: Web Element
webElement.description: A link for more information regarding this element.

casRegistryId.title: CAS Registry Number
casRegistryId.description: A CAS Registry Number, also referred to as CASRN or CAS Number, is a unique numerical identifier assigned by the Chemical Abstracts Service to every chemical substance described in the open scientific literature, including organic and inorganic compounds, minerals, isotopes, alloys and nonstructurable materials.

https://gs1.org/voc/GeoCoordinates.title: Geographic Coordinates
https://gs1.org/voc/GeoCoordinates.description: The geographic coordinates of a place or event.

https://gs1.org/voc/latitude.title: Latitude
https://gs1.org/voc/latitude.description: Angular distance North or South from the earth's equator measured through 90 degrees.

https://gs1.org/voc/longitude.title: Longitude
https://gs1.org/voc/longitude.description: The arc or portion of the earth's equator intersected between the meridian of a given place and the prime meridian and expressed in degrees.

schema.title: Geographic Coordinates
schema.description: The geographic coordinates of a place or event.

latitude.title: Latitude
latitude.description: Angular distance North or South from the earth's equator measured through 90 degrees.

longitude.title: Longitude
longitude.description: The arc or portion of the earth's equator intersected between the meridian of a given place and the prime meridian and expressed in degrees.

https://gs1.org/voc/Place.title: Place
https://gs1.org/voc/Place.description: Entities that have a somewhat fixed, physical location.

https://gs1.org/voc/globalLocationNumber.title: Global Location Number (GLN)
https://gs1.org/voc/globalLocationNumber.description: A Global Location Number (GLN) is the GS1 Identification Key used to identify physical locations or parties. The key comprises a GS1 Company Prefix, Location Reference and Check Digit. For more information see http://www.gs1.org/gln.

https://gs1.org/voc/GeoCoordinates.title: Geographic Coordinates
https://gs1.org/voc/GeoCoordinates.description: Links to information about geocoordinates for a place.

https://gs1.org/voc/PostalAddress.title: Postal Address
https://gs1.org/voc/PostalAddress.description: The postal address for an organization or place.

schema.title: Place
schema.description: Entities that have a somewhat fixed, physical location.

globalLocationNumber.title: Global Location Number (GLN)
globalLocationNumber.description: A Global Location Number (GLN) is the GS1 Identification Key used to identify physical locations or parties. The key comprises a GS1 Company Prefix, Location Reference and Check Digit. For more information see http://www.gs1.org/gln.

geo.title: Geographic Coordinates
geo.description: Links to information about geocoordinates for a place.

address.title: Postal Address
address.description: The postal address for an organization or place.

https://gs1.org/voc/PostalAddress.title: Postal Address
https://gs1.org/voc/PostalAddress.description: The location at which a particular organization or person may be found or reached.

https://gs1.org/voc/organizationName.title: Organization Name
https://gs1.org/voc/organizationName.description: The name of the organization expressed in text.

https://gs1.org/voc/streetAddress.title: Street Address
https://gs1.org/voc/streetAddress.description: The street address expressed as free form text. The street address is printed on paper as the first lines below the name. For example, the name of the street and the number in the street or the name of a building.

https://gs1.org/voc/addressLocality.title: Address Locality
https://gs1.org/voc/addressLocality.description: Text specifying the name of the locality, for example a city.

https://gs1.org/voc/addressRegion.title: Address Region
https://gs1.org/voc/addressRegion.description: Text specifying a province or state in abbreviated format for example NJ.

https://gs1.org/voc/addressCountry.title: Address Country
https://gs1.org/voc/addressCountry.description: Code specifying the country (and country subdivision) for the address using ISO 3166-1.

https://gs1.org/voc/crossStreet.title: Cross Street
https://gs1.org/voc/crossStreet.description: A street intersecting a main street (usually at right angles) and continuing on both sides of it.

https://gs1.org/voc/countyCode.title: County Code
https://gs1.org/voc/countyCode.description: A code that identifies a county. A county is a territorial division in some countries, forming the chief unit of local administration. In the US, a county is a political and administrative division of a state.

https://gs1.org/voc/postalCode.title: Postal Code
https://gs1.org/voc/postalCode.description: Text specifying the postal code for an address.

https://gs1.org/voc/postOfficeBoxNumber.title: Post Office Box Number
https://gs1.org/voc/postOfficeBoxNumber.description: The number that identifies a PO box. A PO box is a box in a post office or other postal service location assigned to an organization where postal items may be kept.
